alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Saline; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 27 at 8:29AM CDT until further notice by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Illinois, including the following counties, Hamilton, Saline and White. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 824 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms had moved out of the area. However, water will be slow to recede due to 2 to 3 inches of rain that occurred this morning. Several inches of water have been reported over some roadways including Hwy 142 in Broughton and along portions of Hwy 1, 45, and 14 in White County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Carmi, Grayville, Norris City, Galatia, Crossville, Enfield, Broughton, Maunie and Phillipstown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
